a.title: Alfa
meaning: I have a diver down; keep well clear at slow speed.

b.title: Bravo
meaning: I am taking in, or discharging, or carrying dangerous goods.

c.title: Charlie
meaning: Yes (affirmative or “The significance of the previous group should be read in the affirmative”).

d.title: Delta
meaning: Keep clear of me; I am maneuvering with difficulty.

e.title: Echo
meaning: I am altering my course to starboard.

f.title: Foxtrot
meaning: I am disabled; communicate with me.

g.title: Golf
meaning: I require a pilot. When made by fishing vessels operating in close proximity on the fishing grounds it means: “I am hauling nets”.

h.title: Hotel
meaning: I have a pilot on board.

i.title: India
meaning: I am altering my course to port.

j.title: Juliet
meaning: I am on fire and have dangerous cargo on board: keep well clear of me, or I am leaking dangerous cargo.

k.title: Kilo
meaning: I wish to communicate with you.

l.title: Lima
meaning: You should stop your vessel instantly.

m.title: Mike
meaning: My vessel is stopped and making no way through the water.

n.title: November
meaning: No (negative or “The significance of the previous group should be read in the negative”).

o.title: Oscar
meaning: Man overboard.

p.title: Papa
meaning: In harbor: All persons should report on board as the vessel is about to proceed to sea. At sea: It may be used by fishing vessels to mean: “My nets have come fast upon an obstruction”. It may alsobe used as a sound to mean: “I require a pilot”.

q.title: Quebec
meaning: My vessel is “healthy” and I request free pratique.

s.title: Sierra
meaning: I am operating astern propulsion.

t.title: Tango
meaning: Keep clear of me; I am engaged in pair trawling.

u.title: Uniform
meaning: You are running into danger.

v.title: Victor
meaning: I require assistance.

w.title: Whiskey
meaning: I require medical assistance.

x.title: Xray
meaning: Stop carrying out your intentions and watch for my signals.

y.title: Yankee
meaning: I am dragging my anchor.

z.title: Zulu
meaning: I require a tug. When made by fishing vessels operating in close proximity on the fishing grounds it means: “I am shooting nets”
